reg_pit.title: Extraprovincial Limited Liability Partnerships and Limited Partnerships from a Designated Province Regulation

change.changenote: Section 1 definition of "registration statement" BEFORE amended by BC Reg 119/2013, effective July 1, 2013.

definition.def: means data about a foreign partnership, an extraprovincial limited liability partnership or a limited partnership received electronically by the registrar from the extraprovincial registrar.

change.changenote: Section 2 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 119/2013, effective July 1, 2013.

section.sectiontext: For the purposes of Part 7 of the Act and this regulation, Alberta is a designated province.

change.changenote: Section 2 (c) was added by BC Reg 268/2019, effective January 1, 2020.
Section 3 (4) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 15/2018, effective December 14, 2018.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Sections 89, 93 (b) and (k) to (m) and 115 (2) to (5) of the Act do not apply in respect of a foreign partnership.

change.changenote: Section 5 (1) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 15/2018, effective December 14, 2018.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The registrar may register a foreign partnership as an extraprovincial limited liability partnership if the foreign partnership files with the registrar a registration statement that contains the information required by the registrar.

change.changenote: Section 6 (2) (c) BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 119/2013, effective July 1, 2013.

paragraph.paragraphtext: publish notice of the registration on a website maintained by or on behalf of the government of British Columbia, and

change.changenote: Section 6 (1) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 15/2018, effective December 14, 2018.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The registrar may register a foreign partnership as a limited partnership if the foreign partnership files with the registrar a registration statement that contains the information required by the registrar.

change.changenote: Section 8 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 15/2018, effective December 14, 2018.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2), the registrar must not file

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a registration statement under section 5 or 6, or
an amendment to a registration statement under section 10

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: that contains a business name that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is the name by which a corporation is incorporated, registered or continued in British Columbia, or
so nearly resembles that name that in the opinion of the registrar it is likely to confuse or mislead or is a name of which the registrar, in the registrar's discretion, disapproves.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The registrar may file information or an amendment referred to in subsection (1) if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the corporation consents in writing, or
the business name was used by the applicant for registration before the corporation first used its name.

change.changenote: Section 12 (2) and (3) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 119/2013, effective July 1, 2013.

subsection.subsectiontext: Without limiting subsection (1), the registrar may collect a name search fee in the amount of $30 for a name search required by the extraprovincial registrar and transmit the fee to the service provider.
In subsection (2), service provider means the service provider designated by the registrar to perform a name search required by the extraprovincial registrar.
